titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Susan M. Chambré Research Files on Volunteer AIDS Organizations
Chambré (Susan M.) Research Files on Volunteer AIDS Organizations
titlestmt.author: compiled by Christy Tomecek

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:28

did.unittitle: Susan M. Chambré research files on volunteer AIDS organizations

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of printed material collected by Susan M. Chambré for her research on AIDS organizations and advocacy. This research was used for a series of articles in professional journals as well as the book Fighting for Our Lives: New York's AIDS Community and the Politics of Disease (Rutgers University Press, 2006). The material includes annual reports, unpublished reports, newsletters, news clippings, journal articles, pamphlets, board minutes and other material from nearly 100 AIDS-related organizations. Materials date from 1981 to 2015.

langmaterial.language: The material is in English and Spanish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of printed material collected by Susan M. Chambré for her research on AIDS organizations and advocacy. This research was used for a series of articles in professional journals as well as the book Fighting for Our Lives: New York's AIDS Community and the Politics of Disease (Rutgers University Press, 2006). The material includes annual reports, unpublished reports, newsletters, news clippings, journal articles, pamphlets, board minutes and other material from nearly 100 AIDS-related organizations. Materials date from 1981 to 2015.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by Susan M. Chambré for materials she has authored or otherwise produced. After the lifetime of Susan M. Chambré or on January 1, 2021, whichever occurs first, copyright passes to Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series: I. Topical files, 1984-2013. II. AIDS organization files, 1981-2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Susan M. Chambré Research Files on Volunteer AIDS Organizations (MS 2054). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Susan M. Chambré is a sociologist and academic whose scholarly work focuses on civic engagement, nonprofit organizations and public policy. She received her B.A. in Sociology from Queens College, City University of New York and her A.M. and Ph.D from the University of Pennsylvania. She was a research scientist at the New York City Human Resources Administration. She later became a professor and taught at the State University of New York at Stony Brook, Yeshiva University, and Baruch College, City University of New York, where she retired from in 2016. She has published several books, including Patients, Consumers and Civil Society (2008), Fighting for Our Lives: New York's AIDS Community and the Politics of Disease (2006), and Good Deeds in Old Age: Volunteering by the New Leisure Class (1987). She has also published several articles in journals such as Nonprofit and Voluntary Sector Quarterly and Nonprofit Management and Leadership .

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Copies of the newsletter Newsline , published by the People With AIDS Coalition (PWAC) and dating from 1986 to 1999, were separated from the collection and added to the General Collection at Sterling Memorial Library.

Community health services
LGBTQ resource

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series comprises research materials related to New York City AIDS organizations, often from a local govenrment perspective. Materials include reports on addressing the AIDS crisis in New York City and New York State, information on funding from both government and private sources, and research on policy.

did.unittitle: New York City Interagency Task Force on AIDS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series comprises materials collected from different AIDS advocacy organizations based in New York City. These materials can include pamphlets, fliers, newsletters, printouts from organization websites, memoranda, and correspondence. There are also newspaper and magazine articles written about the organizations. The organization that is the most heavily documented is the People With AIDS Coalition; other prominent organizations include Gay Men's Health Crisis (GMHC) and the Association for Drug Abuse and Treatment (ADAPT). There are also some general materials, including several directories of AIDS-related organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by organization.
